channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Could you service an audience of 10 Million+?
item.description: Sometimes when young companies reach a certain level of success, complacency sets in. The culture (subtly) shifts from entrepreneurial to bureaucratic. Thatâ€™s not this client.

item.title: Love independent music? Hipster not a dirty word to you? Drive forward independent music with Perl in London
item.description: Drive forward independent music with Perl in London

item.title: Junior Perl developer needed to help a charity and giving-focused team in Kent, UK
item.description: Get on the road to career growth while making a positive impact for the world

item.title: Perl mentor needed for large and growing team - train the next generation of Perl developers in London
item.description: Can you help guide and grow the experience of junior Perl developers?

item.title: A love-fest of job satisfaction
item.description: What if you had a job you loved, and that job helped other people find jobs they loved?

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: Inverse Live Coding: A practice for learning web development
item.description: A new teaching faculty at the University of Michigan shares his view about practical web development.

item.title: Types::Mojo
item.description: A very handy distribution if you play with Mojolicious by Renee Baecker.

item.title: NetLogo for scientific research: Modeling
item.description: Peter gave us brief introduction of the very handy tool NetLogo.

item.title: The startup stack that wasnâ€™t
item.description: Leo looks at the best tech and development approaches of today in preparation for a start up.

item.title: Untrusted Numeric Input -- /[0-9]/
item.description: Tom shares his detailed further analysis of his earlier blog about the same subject.

item.title: Pull Request Tracker
item.description: Here I shared my personal PR analysis. Please take a look at some interesting facts.

item.title: Which programming languages should you learn?
item.description: Marty started with basic question but gave very elaborate and descriptive answers. Highly recommended.

item.title: AWS Lambdas & Perl Teaser
item.description: Robert Lauer announced release of version 0.0.1 of a framework for creating Perl Lambdas.

item.title: #394 - Pull Request Club
item.description:
Hi there

For those who have had the opportunity to be part of Pull Request Challenge organised by Neil Bowers should be aware that we now have Pull Request Club running successfully since January 2019. Thanks to its creator Kivanc Yazan. It is still very much in early stages. I am sure Kivanc would love to hear any suggestions.

I remember during Pull Request Challenge days, there were few organisations participated as a group and worked on alloted distribution. I knew, one such group, CV-Library. I was wondering if something similar is happening with Pull Request Club. If not then I would request them to join the club and contribute like before.

Last but not the least, if anyone needs helping hand then please get in touch with me.

Finally enjoy reading this week newsletter and don't forget to share with your friends.
